com.stormpath.shiro.realm

Class CustomDataPermissionResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.shiro.realm.CustomDataPermissionResolver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccountCustomDataPermissionResolver, GroupCustomDataPermissionResolver

    public class CustomDataPermissionResolver
extends Object
    A CustomDataPermissionResolver accesses a specific named field value of a CustomData resource that contains a Set&lt;String&gt; of Shiro permission Strings.

    The permissions stored in that field are assumed to be assigned to the CustomData's owning entity (an Account or Group).

    Custom Data Field Name

    You can configure what named field is used to store the permissions via fieldName property.

    String to Permission Conversion

    The Strings stored in the CustomData resource are converted to Shiro Permission instances via the permissionResolver property. Unless overridden, the default instance is a Shiro WildcardPermissionResolver.
    Since:
    0.5
    See Also:
    AccountCustomDataPermissionResolver, GroupCustomDataPermissionResolver

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CustomDataPermissionResolver()
      Creates a new instance, using the default customDataFieldName of apacheShiroPermissions and a default WildcardPermissionResolver.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CustomDataPermissionResolver

        public CustomDataPermissionResolver()
        Creates a new instance, using the default customDataFieldName of apacheShiroPermissions and a default WildcardPermissionResolver.

    • Method Detail

      • getCustomDataFieldName

        public String getCustomDataFieldName()
        Returns the name of the CustomData field used to store the Set&lt;String&gt; of permissions. The default name is apacheShiroPermissions, implying a CustomData JSON representation as follows: 
         {
     ... any other of your own custom data properties ...,

     "apacheShiroPermissions": [
         "perm1",
         "perm2",
         ...,
         "permN"j
     ]
 }
        You can change the name by calling setCustomDataFieldName(String).
        Returns:
        the name of the CustomData field used to store the Set&lt;String&gt; of permissions.

      • setCustomDataFieldName

        public void setCustomDataFieldName(String customDataFieldName)
        Sets the name of the CustomData field used to store the Set&lt;String&gt; of permissions. The default name is apacheShiroPermissions, implying a CustomData JSON representation as follows: 
         {
     ... any other of your own custom data properties ...,

     "apacheShiroPermissions": [
         "perm1",
         "perm2",
         ...,
         "permN"j
     ]
 }
        If you changed this name to be myApplicationPermissions for example, the CustomData representation would look something like this instead: 
         {
     ... any other of your own custom data properties ...,

     "myApplicationPermissions": [
         "perm1",
         "perm2",
         ...,
         "permN"j
     ]
 }
        Parameters:
        customDataFieldName - the name of the CustomData field used to store the Set&lt;String&gt; of permissions.

      • getPermissionResolver

        public org.apache.shiro.authz.permission.PermissionResolver getPermissionResolver()
        Returns the PermissionResolver used to convert stored permission strings to Shiro Permission instances for Subject authorization.

        The default / pre-configured instance is a WildcardPermissionResolver.

        Returns:
        the PermissionResolver used to convert stored permission strings to Shiro Permission instances for Subject authorization.

      • setPermissionResolver

        public void setPermissionResolver(org.apache.shiro.authz.permission.PermissionResolver permissionResolver)
        Sets the PermissionResolver used to convert stored permission strings to Shiro Permission instances for Subject authorization.
        Parameters:
        permissionResolver - the PermissionResolver used to convert stored permission strings to Shiro Permission instances for Subject authorization.

      • getPermissionStrings

        protected Set<String> getPermissionStrings(com.stormpath.sdk.directory.CustomData customData)
        Returns a Set&lt;String&gt; of permission strings that are stored in the specified CustomData instance (under the customDataFieldName key), or an empty collection if no permissions are stored.

        This implementation internally delegates field access and Set construction to a CustomDataPermissionsEditor instance, e.g. 

         return new CustomDataPermissionsEditor(customData)
     .setFieldName(getCustomDataFieldName())
     .getPermissionStrings();
        Parameters:
        customData - the custom data instance that might have a Set&lt;String&gt; of permissions stored in a key named getCustomDataFieldName().
        Returns:
        a Set&lt;String&gt; of permission strings that are stored in the specified CustomData instance (under the customDataFieldName key), or an empty collection if no permissions are stored.
        See Also:
        CustomDataPermissionsEditor

      • getPermissions

        protected Set<org.apache.shiro.authz.Permission> getPermissions(com.stormpath.sdk.directory.CustomData customData)
        Returns a set of Shiro Permission instances stored in the specified CustomData resource. This implementation will:
        1. Get all permission strings stored in the CustomData instance
        2. Loop over these strings, and for each one, create a Permission instance using the permissionResolver property.
        3. Return the total constructed Set of Permission instances to the caller.
        Parameters:
        customData - the CustomData instance that may contain permission strings to obtain
        Returns:
        a set of Shiro Permission instances stored in the specified CustomData resource.
